abstract.p: CBS's 48 Hours Mysteries, a repackaging of reports from past season of 48 Hours news-magazine show, gets better ratings than they did originally (S)

block.p: When is a repeat better than a first run of a show? The answer: When it is a summer edition of a news-magazine show.

The CBS news magazine ''48 Hours,'' which spends the regular television season getting drubbed on Thursday nights by NBC's ''E.R.,'' kicked off a monthlong run of repeats repackaged as ''48 Hours Mysteries'' on Monday night.
When is a repeat better than a first run of a show? The answer: When it is a summer edition of a news-magazine show.

The CBS news magazine ''48 Hours,'' which spends the regular television season getting drubbed on Thursday nights by NBC's ''E.R.,'' kicked off a monthlong run of repeats repackaged as ''48 Hours Mysteries'' on Monday night.
The result was a higher rating than ''48 Hours'' reached all television season with original shows. This was a repeat from October about the murder of a Michigan woman.
The news magazine will have five of these mystery editions on Mondays and Saturdays for the rest of the month.

The repeat of ''48 Hours'' was by far the most watched program Monday night. Left in the dust was the Devils-Stars, N.H.L. Stanley Cup Finals game on ABC, providing further proof that hockey is a not-ready-for-prime-time sport.
''48 Hours'' almost quadrupled the audience for the hockey game, which was not a repeat.
